word: Children should be early taught, in simple, easy lessons, the rudiments of physiology and hygiene. . . . They should understand the importance of guarding against disease by preserving the vigor of every organ and should also be taught how to deal with common diseases and accidents. Every school should give instruction in both physiology and hygiene, and, so far as possible, should be provided with facilities for illustrating the structure, use, and care of the body.—Education, pp. 195, 196.
